identity.mission: Create a speed test utility that feels like a warp drive engine interface.

typography.instructions: Import 'Orbitron' (weights 400, 700, 900) and 'Rajdhani' (weights 400, 500, 600) from Google Fonts. Use Orbitron for all speed numbers and headings. Use Rajdhani for labels and body text.

layout.structure: Single Page Application (SPA). Centered 'Reactor Core' (Speedometer) with peripheral data modules.
layout.spacing: Generous padding (p-8 to p-12). Use CSS Grid for the main layout.
layout.grid_system: Bento Grid Mode A (The Tetris Grid) for the results section. Asymmetrical layout for visual interest.
layout.background_strategy: Use a dark, noise-textured background with a subtle geometric overlay. Do not use plain black.

Speedometer.instructions: Create a custom circular gauge. The needle should leave a 'light trail'. The arc should glow intensely. Do NOT use a generic library if it looks 'stock'. If using a library, heavily customize it to look like a sci-fi HUD.
Speedometer.animation: Smooth transition for the needle. Use 'ease-out' easing. The numbers should 'scramble' or count up digitally.

StartButton.instructions: Large, pill-shaped or hexagonal. On hover, it should glitch (shift colors/position slightly). Text: 'INITIATE' or 'RUN TEST'.
StartButton.classes: bg-transparent border-2 border-primary text-primary hover:bg-primary hover:text-black transition-all duration-300 shadow-[0_0_20px_rgba(0,243,255,0.4)]

ResultCard.instructions: Dark glass background (bg-black/40 backdrop-blur-md). 1px border in primary or secondary neon color. Glowing numbers.

visual_enhancers.textures: Add a fixed background layer with a 'scanline' or 'noise' effect (opacity 0.05).
visual_enhancers.decorations: Use decorative SVG lines (circuit board style) in the corners of the screen.
visual_enhancers.motion: Entrance animations: Staggered fade-in + slide-up for elements. Speedometer: Elastic bounce on load.

assets.icons: Use 'lucide-react' but style them with a glow filter (drop-shadow).

images.description: Abstract geometric neon grid to be used as a subtle background overlay (low opacity).

tech_stack.charts: recharts (for history graph if needed, otherwise custom SVG)

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALLATION: Run 'npm install framer-motion' immediately. This is essential for the smooth speedometer animations.
2. FONT SETUP: Add the Google Fonts import link for Orbitron and Rajdhani to 'index.html' or 'index.css'.
3. GLOBAL STYLES: Set 'body' background to #030305 and text to white. Apply the background image with opacity 0.1.

4. SPEEDOMETER LOGIC: Since there is no backend, MOCK the speed test logic using `setTimeout` and `Math.random` to simulate the phases: Ping -> Jitter -> Download -> Upload. Make the values realistic (e.g., Download 50-500 Mbps).
5. DEPLOYMENT: Ensure the app builds to a static 'dist' folder for XAMPP/NGINX compatibility. No SSR.
6. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure neon colors have enough contrast against the dark background. Use the 'glow' for decoration, but keep the core text sharp white.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
